intro: Taonabo microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited taonabo, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that contain several seeds. Taonabo microcarpa is typically found in moist, shaded habitats within the rainforests of Madagascar.
